titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Andrew M. Canepa collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-04-12T15:45-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: April 1, 2016: Revised to add photograph card catalog data

did.abstract: Printed miscellany relating to Father Charles E. Coughlin; and photographs of Coughlin, President Calvin Coolidge and his family and Cabinet, Father James Cox (leader of the Jobless Party and the Blue Shirt Army), and American World War II posters.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Andrew M. Canepa collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1984.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Printed miscellany relating to Father Charles E. Coughlin; and photographs of Coughlin, President Calvin Coolidge and his family and Cabinet, Father James Cox (leader of the Jobless Party and the Blue Shirt Army), and American World War II posters.

did.unittitle: 1 oversize print of President Calvin Coolidge,
32 prints of President Calvin Coolidge, his family, and his Cabinet,
14 prints of Grace Coolidge, wife of President Calvin Coolidge, 1923-1957
9 prints of Father James Cox, leader of the Jobless Party and the Blue Shirt Army, 1932
21 prints of American posters, including 1 print of an unemployment census poster and 20 prints of World War II posters,
48 prints of Father Charles E. Coughlin, including prints of Coughlin with Congressman William Lemke, Gerald L. K. Smith, and Dr. Francis E. Townsend,
Printed miscellany relating to Father Charles E. Coughlin,
